rules.title: Initial Call Greeting
rules.action: Acknowledge call, thank caller, ask how to assist
rules.example: Hello, thank you for calling [Clinic Name]. How may I help you today?

rules.title: Specific Staff Request
rules.condition: Caller asks for a specific staff member
rules.action: Ask for staff member's name and purpose, inform of brief hold to check availability
rules.example: Certainly. May I ask who you're trying to reach and the purpose of your call? I'll just check their availability for you, which may take a moment.

rules.title: Determine Patient Status
rules.condition: Caller requests to book an appointment
rules.action: Ask if the patient is new or established
rules.example: Are you a new patient with us, or have you been seen here before?

rules.title: Identify Established Patient
rules.condition: Caller identifies as an established patient
rules.action: Acknowledge status, request phone number or date of birth to locate chart
rules.example: Okay, great. To pull up your chart, could I please have your phone number or date of birth?

rules.title: Chart Retrieval Notification
rules.condition: Patient identification (phone number/DOB) received for an established patient
rules.action: Inform customer chart will be pulled up, mention brief hold
rules.example: Thank you. I'll just pull up your chart now. This may take a moment, so I might place you on a brief hold.

rules.title: New Patient Insurance Inquiry
rules.condition: Caller identifies as a new patient
rules.action: Check availability, inquire about insurance, ask for provider's name if applicable
rules.example: Alright, for new patients, we'll need to check availability and also verify your insurance. Do you have insurance you'll be using today? If so, could you tell me your provider's name?

rules.title: Ascertain Appointment Type
rules.condition: Patient type determined and chart retrieved (if established)
rules.action: Ask for the specific type of appointment needed
rules.example: Now that we have your information, what kind of appointment are you looking to schedule today?

rules.title: Long Absence Re-evaluation
rules.condition: Established patient returning after a long absence, and appointment type is being discussed
rules.action: Suggest a re-evaluation type of exam
rules.example: Since it's been a while, we might recommend a re-evaluation exam to ensure we address any new concerns.

rules.title: Preferred Date/Time
rules.action: Inquire about preferred dates or times
rules.example: Okay, and do you have any preferred dates or times that work best for you?

rules.title: Confirm Preferred Date/Time
rules.condition: Patient provides preferred dates or times for an appointment
rules.action: Acknowledge and confirm the patient's stated date and time preferences to ensure accuracy.
rules.example: You're looking for an appointment on Tuesday afternoons, correct?

rules.title: Check Appointment Availability
rules.condition: Patient's preferred dates/times have been acknowledged and confirmed
rules.action: Inform the patient that you are checking the scheduling system for available slots based on their preferences.
rules.example: Okay, let me check our schedule now for Tuesday afternoons.

rules.title: Offer Available Appointment Slots
rules.condition: Appointment availability has been checked based on patient preferences
rules.action: Present the patient with available appointment slots, explicitly stating the exact date and time for each option.
rules.example: I have an opening on Tuesday, November 7th at 10:00 AM, or Wednesday, November 8th at 2:30 PM. Do either of those work for you?
